snippet: Thousands more have been displaced in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir and in neighboring Pakistan. Rescue efforts were hampered Monday by high waters.
abstract: Relief operations struggle in Indian-administered portion of Kashmir and in parts of Pakistan where six days of rain and flooding have left hundreds of people dead.

byline.original: By NIDA NAJAR and SALMAN MASOOD
byline.contributor: Nida Najar reported from New Delhi, and Salman Masood from Islamabad, Pakistan. Reporting was contributed by Hari Kumar and Betwa Sharma from New Delhi; Sameer Yasir from Srinagar, Kashmir; and Waqar Gillani from Lahore, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Thousands more have been displaced in the Indian state of Jammu and Kashmir and in neighboring Pakistan. Rescue efforts were hampered Monday by high waters.

headline.main: India and Pakistan Strain as Flooding Kills Hundreds
headline.print_headline: India and Pakistan Strain as Flooding Kills Hundreds
